results.title: Letter from America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Correspondent”.
This is the second part of a two-part program which explores the rift between America and the Muslim world. Playwright and critic Bonnie Greer was born in Chicago. She then spent several years working in New York before moving to London where she has spent the last 15 years working in theatre and writing. Bonnie decided to go home to America to talk to family and friends about September 11 and whether it has changed their feelings about America and being American. Through her interviews with members of her family (Black American, middle-class), her priest, university students, friends and co-workers from the past, Bonnie discovered that if Americans were arrogant, it was an arrogance born out of ignorance and that since September 11, many Americans were beginning to do some soul-searching and treating the terrorist attack as a wake-up call. The common thread appears to be a feeling of powerlessness and a lack of information being passed on to the general population by all aspects of the media and the Government. Education is so insular and parochial that young students do not even know where Pakistan or Afghanistan are on the map. Television broadcasts appear to be more for entertainment rather than providing for any analytical value. This documentary, along with “Letter to America”, certainly provides the viewer an opportunity to see and hear two differing attitudes and opinions from just everyday people at opposite ends of the spectrum - religiously and politically. But are they so different? And can people change? It seems at the end of the day that all most people want is peace and to live without fear. For more information: http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/programmes/correspondent/1698317.stm

results.title: Letter to America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Correspondent”.
First of two programs exploring the rift between America and the Muslim world. Shortly after September 11 2001, Syrian born Rana Kabbani, returned to the Middle East to find out how Muslims have come to view the United States. Her journey took her to Egypt, the United Arab Emirates and Iran. She wanted to know why there was so much hatred towards America. Was it religious - Muslims against Christians - or were there other reasons for this apparent hatred? And yet for all the hatred and anger towards America, many Arabs expressed sympathy for the American people and made it clear that they did not condone terrorism or what occurred on September 11. The United States however is accused of interference and domination, hypocrisy and double standards, exploiting the Middle East for its oil and using their land for its military bases - 27,000 American military personnel are currently based in the desert of Egypt. This documentary presents a Muslim perspective from the street Arabs to the intelligentsia and includes interviews with Egyptian filmmaker Khaled Youssef (“The Storm”), Iraqui musician Naseer Shamma, Palestinian journalist Atef Helwa, Sheik Nahyan one of the ruling elite in the United Arab Emirates, various academics and and a group of American Christian students on a study tour of the Middle East. Also discusses America’s close relationship with Israel, its past occupations, bombings and economic exploitations which have affected many countries around the world, but particularly the Islamic countries including Afghanistan, Iran, Iraq and Palestine. A most interesting insight into the hearts and minds of a people often portrayed in a damming way by the politicians and media of the West. Contains archival and some b&w footage. For more information: http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/programmes/correspondent/1698317.stm

results.title: Bad girls. Series two
results.creator_credit: Brian Park and Shed Productions (Jailbirds) Ltd
results.brief_description: Inspired by the success of Australia’s “Prisoner” comes the British production of “Bad girls”, also set in a women only prison. Governor of G Ward is Helen Stewart (Simone Lahbib), a boss with a conscience unafraid of standing up for the rights of the prisoners. The core group of women comprise of: Shell (Debra Stephenson), a lifer and the toughest woman on the ward, Denny (Alicia Eyo), Shell’s faithful sidekick and occasional lover, Nikki (Mandana Jones) a thinking lesbian who isn’t afraid to speak her mind and has unresolved sexual tension with the Governor, and the Julies, 2 women called Julie fond of finishing one another’s sentences. An engrossing mix of violence inflicted by women towards women and the inadequacies of the prison system, it also attempts to capture the vagary of relationships and emotions experienced by women who share confined quarters and are without civil liberties. Devised by Maureen Chadwick, Eileen Gallagher and Ann McManus, this award winning series is now in its 5th season. Season two saw the arrival of Karen Betts (Claire King) and Barbara Hunt (Isabelle Amyes), and more high profile stories for Yvonne Atkins, Crystal and Zandra. For more information, visit the official website http://www.badgirls.co.uk

results.title: Bad girls. Series two. Discs 1 & 2 [DVD]
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Bad girls. Series two”.
Tug of love (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Mike Adams): Helen is suspected of going AWOL and Jim’s eyeing off her job. Zandra goes into labour and complications ensue from her drug habit. Karen Betts (Claire King) returns to the wing. “Shit happens” (wri. Martin Allen, dir. Mike Adams): Jim’s wife is getting prank calls from Shell and Jim blames Nikki. Helen hands in her resignation and Fenner is temporarily stood down pending an investigation into an assault on Shell. “Visiting time” (wri. Mark Wadlow, dir. Laurence Moody): Karen Betts becomes Wing Governor. Yvonne helps Julie see her kids. Investigations are underway into the assault case against Shell. “Looking for love” (wri. Jayne Hollinson, dir. Laurence Moody): Dominic becomes Shell’s personal officer. Denny leaves the wing to visit her mother in hospital. The Julies help organise a romantic dinner. “Mistaken identity” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Laurence Moody): Group therapy sessions begin and HIV+ Mad Tessa Spall arrives on the wing. Fenner and Atkins form a mutually beneficial alliance. Wade gets a new roommate. “Losing it” (wri. Martin Allen, dir. Jim O’Hanlon): Sylvia’s given a new exercise regime and Zandra finally gets glasses. Barbara is feeling uncomfortable living with Nikki. Josh and Crystal’s relationship is progressing and Shell starts an anti-male campaign. Helen’s back on the ward working with area management, meaning she can spend more time with Nikki. “The Set up” (wri. Phil Ford, dir. Jim O’Hanlon): Shell’s under observation in the medical ward. Zandra collapses and further investigation is required to find out what’s wrong. Fenner’s being blackmailed by Atkins but he has the last word. “Babes behind bars” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Jim O’Hanlon): Shell’s worrying about the safety of her children. It’s Crystal’s last week and Yvonne comes up with a way to earn a few extra quid. Barbara helps out by setting up the website, “Babes behind bars”. The results are back from Zandra’s test.

group.title: Bad girls. Series two
group.creator_credit: Brian Park and Shed Productions (Jailbirds) Ltd

results.title: Bad girls. Series two. Discs 3 & 4 [DVD]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bad girls. Series two”.
The Leaving: (wri. Jayne Hollinson, dir. Mike Adams): Shell’s back on enhanced and is targetting Barbara. Dominic and Zandra are drawn closer through her illness. Denny and Crystal get a new roommate in the young Shaz. “Family plan” (wri. Phil Ford, dir. Mike Adams): Shaz explains to Denny the circumstances of her triple murder charge. Barbara confesses to the attack on Shell. Julie’s trying to have another baby and someone from Yvonne’s past is the latest addtion to the ward. Babes behind bars go under. “Rough justice” (wri. Ann McManus, dir. Mike Adams): Renee’s got it in for everyone and dies under mysterious circumstances. Sylvia is reprimanded over an incident involving Denny and Shaz. Fenner’s having family troubles. “Facing up” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Laurence Moody): Jim’s mind isn’t on the job, to the detriment of his fellow officers. Nikki’s jealous of Helen and Dominic, Helen has a plan to make Shaz realise the consequence of her actions. “Oh what a night” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, Ann McManus, dir. Laurence Moody): Nikki will do anything to spend one night with Helen on the eve of a party to celebrate Sylvia’s 30 years in the service. Crystal leaves Lark Hall.

Barbara confesses to the attack on Shell. Julie’s trying to have another baby and someone from Yvonne’s past is the latest addtion to the ward. Babes behind bars go under. “Rough justice” (wri. Ann McManus, dir. Mike Adams): Renee’s got it in for everyone and dies under mysterious circumstances. Sylvia is reprimanded over an incident involving Denny and Shaz. Fenner’s having family troubles. “Facing up” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Laurence Moody): Jim’s mind isn’t on the job, to the detriment of his fellow officers. Nikki’s jealous of Helen and Dominic, Helen has a plan to make Shaz realise the consequence of her actions. “Oh what a night” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, Ann McManus, dir. Laurence Moody): Nikki will do anything to spend one night with Helen on the eve of a party to celebrate Sylvia’s 30 years in the service. Crystal leaves Lark Hall.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Bad girls. Series two”.
The Leaving: (wri. Jayne Hollinson, dir. Mike Adams): Shell’s back on enhanced and is targetting Barbara. Dominic and Zandra are drawn closer through her illness. Denny and Crystal get a new roommate in the young Shaz. “Family plan” (wri. Phil Ford, dir. Mike Adams): Shaz explains to Denny the circumstances of her triple murder charge. results.title: Bonanza: The Ape. The Savage
results.creator_credit: David Dortort and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bonanza”.
The Ape (dir. James P. Yarbrough): Hoss befriends Arnie Gurne - a lumbering, disabled, man who knows how to fight. Hoss, respectful of his physical prowess, puts Arnie to work on the farm. His best intentions backfire however when Hoss is accused of harbouring a criminal after Arnie turns on the object of his affection, saloon girl Sharie, and kills her. A posse is set out to capture the misunderstood Gurne. “The Savage” (dir. James Neilson): Shoshone Indians kill two fur trappers after they enter a sacred burial ground. Of this tribe, two of them cross over the forbidden stone to find the spirit of White Buffalo Woman to save their ailing tribe. When one of them makes contact with her, they discover she is a flesh and blood white woman, not a spirit, and vow to kidnap her and return to the village exposing her mortality. Adam is injured by Indians protecting the woman and finds himself nursed by White Buffalo Woman with whom he falls in love. Cast includes: Dan Blocker, Michael Landon, Lorne Greene, Pernell Roberts.

results.title: The Honour of Cochise
results.creator_credit: Don McDougall, David Dortort and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bonanza”.
In this episode from Season Three of ‘Bonanza’ (first screened 10/8/61), the Cartwrights and a bigoted army captain who takes refuge with them are pinned down by Cochise and his braves. The Cartwrights make camp on their way home, then suddenly have to come to the defense of Army Captain, Moss Johnson, running from an Apache attack. Ben and his sons find themselves surrounded by Cochise and his people who refuse to leave without Johnson. Ben agrees to hear Cochise’s side of the story and learns that Captain Johnson called Cochise and his people together to talk of peace and used the opportunity to poison them. Adam is shot trying to get water and now Ben faces a dilemma, turn Johnson over to Cochise, or try to go for help and leave his son’s to defend him. Cast includes Lorne Greene, Michael Landon, Dan Blocker, Pernell Roberts and Jeff Morrow.

results.title: The Dark gate
results.creator_credit: Robert Gordon, David Dortort and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bonanza”.
In this episode from Season Two of ‘Bonanza’ (first screened 3/4/61), Adam is puzzled by the bizarre behaviour of his longtime friend and neighbour but is powerless to help him. When Ross becomes physically violent with his wife, Adam removes her from the home to give Ross time to come to his senses. However, Ross’ behavior grows increasingly worse and he progresses to robbery and murder. Cast includes Lorne Greene, Michael Landon, Dan Blocker, Pernell Roberts and James Coburn.
